p: Ulva can be used to feed fish or mollusks such as abalone and reinforce immunity [ 34]. Ulva is now used in integrated multi-trophic aquaculture systems as a partial replacement or supplement for the diet of juvenile Litopenaeus vannamei [ 35]. Harvested Ulva contains a large amount of proteins (up to 30%) with a similar amino acid profile regarding commercial diet, but lower lipid levels (1.9%) and no docosahexaenoic acid. The replacement of up to 25% of the commercial diet with fresh Ulva does not impact shrimp production and juvenile shrimps fed with Ulva have a better growth rate, a higher carotenoid content and a lower lipid content, found in examining shrimp carcasses [ 36].
